channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: When we have heavy downpours it floods the road rather than going down the drain - in winter it then freezes in the road causing a health hazard, 17th July
item.description:
Drain needs to be kept uncovered and free from grass and weeds growing around it so water can drain into this rather than flooding the road - a hazard in winter when the water freezes over.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wellhouse Road, Eden Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Morrisons car park wall knocked down on walk way leading to Nelson Road, 17th July
item.description:
Morrisons car park wall knocked down and remainder of wall is dangerous. There needs to be barriers installed to protect the wall and prevent vehicles slamming into it before someone is seriously hurt. I’m sharing a what3words address to help you find this specific location. Tap to see exactly where it is: ///pouch.enjoyable.common https://w3w.co/pouch.enjoyable.common

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Jenner Close, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A box of rubble has been sitting on the curb for a month, 17th July
item.description:
The box attracts other waste. I reported this last week. Someone came and took away the bags of rubbish around the box - but left the box of rubbish in place. It’s been there for a month. As you see from the attached screenshot I got an email saying the problem had been fixed. IT HASN’T. Please have the rubbish/rubble box removed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 33, Manor Place, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog fouling, 17th July
item.description:
Teenage girl, walking dog that is untrained and out of control. Allowed dog fouling in broad daylight at the corner of the street and made no effort to pick it up. Dog is a young pitbull, beige and cream coloured.

item.title: Urine staining the pavement and road on Portman Mews South, just off the corner of M&S, 17th July
item.description:
I would like to raise a serious concern regarding ongoing anti-social behaviour on Portman Mews South. There is a homeless man who regularly urinates on the street, and on several occasions I have also witnessed instances of defecation and vomiting in the same area from the same individual. I have also witnessed the man masturbating when he was partially covered by a sleeping bag in the middle of the day. This behaviour is creating an absolutely horrific smell and an unpleasant eyesore for myself and everyone who has to walk through the area daily. The situation is extremely distressing, not just because of the offensive odours, but also due to the unhygienic and unsanitary conditions it creates. It is unacceptable that residents, commuters, and local businesses are forced to put up with this level of filth on a regular basis. I understand homelessness is a complex issue, but this behaviour is making the area unsafe, dirty, and degrading for everyone. I am requesting urgent action to address this, including proper intervention, sanitation services, and any appropriate support or enforcement to resolve the issue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 458, Oxford Street, Mayfair, London
Report on FixMyStreet
